definitions: a small object or vessel that stays on the surface of a liquid
a tool or device used to level or smooth a surface
a float representing a theme or advertisement in a parade
a portion of undeposited or delayed funds in banking
a refreshing drink made by adding a scoop of ice cream to soda
examples: The raft was kept afloat by several floats.
The mason used a float for the plaster.
The float in the parade depicted a dragon.
Electronic banking has reduced the float in transactions.
He enjoyed a root beer float for dessert.
